properties.description:
June 25 2014 

"We have been assured that a team will be sent there to bury the victim and possibly disinfect the house she died in. Nothing was said about how to protect the entire community that is now at risk. We will take our own steps to isolate and monitor the entire village in the coming days and weeks. "

http://www.salonepost.com/sp/news/articles/article196.asp
properties.name: A confirmed Ebola woman from Kenema died at Mobai.
A MCHAID nurse dead at Koindu Kissy Teng chiefdom
properties.description:
Before the 19th of June:
"The first index case that came in to the country by passing through Sokoma village bordering with Guinea killed the MCHAID nurse that played with the first case at Koindu Kissy Teng chiefdom in Kailahun district."

http://awoko.org/2014/06/19/sierra-leone-news-kenema-matron-calls-for-support-to-tackle-ebola/

properties.name: At least 2 ebola dead persons
properties.description:
Before 30 June 2014 

Meet Konneh. He’s a volunteer with the #SierraLeone Red Cross. Konneh’s aunt and uncle, from Daru, both died from #Ebola, a virus with a 90% fatality rate. The 21-year-old lives in Kenema, one of the largest cities in Sierra Leone. As of 16 June, there were 92 confirmed cases of Ebola and 44 deaths in Kailahun, according to the World Health Organisation. Across west #Africa there have been more than 522 cases and 333 deaths. Photo: IFRC #guinea #libera #ebolavirus

http://instagram.com/p/p30Ky-klYB/
